snippet.title: Les Murray's state funeral plans confirmed with final farewells to be made at St Mary's Cathedral
snippet.content:
State funeral for Les Murray 0:34
Football: Gladys Berejiklian has extended an offer to the family of the late Les Murray to have a State Funeral.
August 2nd 2017 5 days ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Sport news and galleries/Football/
Iconic SBS football presenter Les Murray AM passed away this morning following a battle with illness. Supplied images from SBS.
Tom Smithies
Share
THE state funeral of Les Murray will take place next Monday at St Mary's Cathedral in Sydney, giving football fans the chance to pay tribute to a giant of the game in Australia. , it was announced that the state funeral promised by Premier Gladys Berejiklian would start at 11am on Monday, with guests attending asked to wear white. The colour has been chosen specifically by Murray's family "in honour of a multicultural world", said a statement on the SBS website.
SBS-TV presenter Les Murray at station's Artarmon studios in Sydney ahead of the 2010 FIFA World Cup finals tournament in South Africa.Source:News Limited Murray came to Australia as a child refugee after being born in Hungary, and saw football as powerful tool to encourage multiculturalism. For more than three decades he was one of football's most vocal proponents, presenting its coverage on SBS and lobbying to boost the game's standing. When she announced last week that Murray would be given a state funeral, Berejiklian called him an "inspiration to many communities". "Les's good work was not limited to sport alone," she said. "Les, who came to Australia as a refugee from Hungary, was an inspiration to many communities across our multicultural society. "Les epitomised the post-war generations of migrants who helped make Australia what it is today. Les passionately embraced his new life and gave back to his community in spades."
